p: Carvacrol or 2-methyl-5-(1-methylethyl)-phenol is monoterpenic phenol occurs in some essential oil plants belonging particularly of the family Lamiaceae ( Ajuga iva, Thymus vulgaris), Asteraceae ( Achillea biebersteinii Afan) and Apiaceae ( Anethum graveolens). It is used in sweets, beverages, and chewing gum as a flavoring agent [ 75]. This bioactive compound has several pharmacological activities including antioxidant [ 76], anti-inflammatory [ 77], antimicrobial [ 78], antibacterial, antiviral [ 79], antitumor [ 80] and hepatoprotective [ 75] properties.
